restaurant.name: Tony's Di Napoli
restaurant.tagline: Classic New York Italian, served family-style
restaurant.description: Tony's Di Napoli is a New York City institution known for serving Southern Italian, family-style dishes meant for sharing. The restaurant specializes in generous portions, classic recipes, and an energetic, warm dining atmosphere.
highlights: Known for huge family-style platters serving 2–3 people
A favorite for celebrations, birthdays, and group dining
Located in the heart of Times Square, popular with locals and tourists alike
Famous for generous portions, fast service, and classic Italian-American dishes

locations.name: Midtown
location_notes: Extremely busy before and after Broadway shows
Ideal for pre-theater and post-theater dining

dining_policies.style: Family-style dining, dishes are large and meant to be shared.
dining_policies.reservations: Reservations accepted and recommended, especially for groups.

large_parties.group_accommodations: Can host large groups, celebrations, and events
large_parties.recommended_notice: Groups of 8+ should reserve in advance

menu.notes: All dishes are served family-style and are large enough to share.

appetizers.name: Fried Calamari
appetizers.description: Crispy fried squid served with marinara sauce
appetizers.popularity: Very popular starter, great for groups

appetizers.name: Baked Clams
appetizers.description: Little neck clams baked with seasoned breadcrumbs

appetizers.name: Mozzarella in Carrozza
appetizers.description: Breaded fried mozzarella with tomato sauce

salads.name: Tony's Famous House Salad
salads.description: Mixed greens, tomato, cucumber, olives, house dressing
salads.popularity: One of the most ordered salads

salads.name: Caesar Salad
salads.description: Crisp romaine, parmesan, creamy Caesar dressing

pasta.name: Lobster Fra Diavolo
pasta.description: Spicy marinara with lobster over linguine

chicken.name: Chicken Parmigiana
chicken.description: Breaded chicken cutlet topped with marinara & mozzarella

chicken.name: Chicken Marsala
chicken.description: Sautéed chicken with mushrooms in marsala wine sauce

chicken.name: Chicken Scarpariello
chicken.description: Sautéed chicken with sausage, peppers & garlic

veal.name: Veal Parmigiana
veal.description: Breaded veal cutlet baked with marinara & mozzarella

veal.name: Veal Marsala
veal.description: Tender veal scallopini with mushroom marsala sauce

seafood.name: Shrimp Scampi
seafood.description: Shrimp sautéed with garlic, lemon & butter

eggplant.name: Eggplant Parmigiana
eggplant.description: Layered breaded eggplant with marinara & cheese

notes: Many dishes contain dairy or gluten due to cheese and pasta.
Seafood dishes may contain shellfish or cross-contamination.
Guests with allergies should notify the server; accommodations may be possible.

faq.question: Do you offer vegetarian options?
faq.answer: Yes, several dishes are vegetarian, including Eggplant Parmigiana, Eggplant Rollatini, salads, pasta dishes, and various sides.

faq.question: Are portions large?
faq.answer: Yes, Tony's is family-style. Most dishes serve 2–3 people, sometimes more.

faq.question: Can I make a reservation for a large group?
faq.answer: Yes, Tony’s is well known for hosting large parties. Reservations are strongly recommended for groups.

faq.question: Is there a kids menu?
faq.answer: There is no separate kids menu, but portions can be shared and many dishes are kid-friendly.
